events.title: Tennis Court Oath
events.description: Members of the French Third Estate took the Tennis Court Oath, vowing not to separate until a constitution for France was established.
events.significance: This event marked a pivotal step in the French Revolution, symbolizing the challenge to monarchical authority and the demand for democratic reforms.

events.title: West Virginia Admitted to the Union
events.description: West Virginia was admitted as the 35th state of the United States during the Civil War, having separated from Confederate Virginia.
events.significance: The admission represented a unique case of state formation during wartime and the division within states over the Civil War.

events.title: Berlin Airlift Begins
events.description: The Allies started the Berlin Airlift in response to the Soviet blockade of West Berlin, delivering vital supplies by air.
events.significance: This operation was a major Cold War confrontation that demonstrated Western commitment to Berlin and intensified East-West tensions.

events.title: Birth of Nicole Kidman
events.description: Nicole Kidman, Australian-American actress and producer known for her versatile roles in film and theater, was born.
events.significance: Nicole Kidman became an influential figure in the entertainment industry, winning multiple awards including an Academy Award.
